executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2020 currency. The Commercial Dishwasher Manufacturing industry includes businesses that primarily produce appliances used to clean and sanitize dishware and cooking implements, as well as market these machines mainly to food service establishments, hotels, food manufacturers and other businesses. Consumer spending at these downstream businesses has grown strongly over the five years to 2020, until the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic in 2020 created unfavorable economic conditions, increasing national unemployment and decreasing consumer spending and the number of businesses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 pandemic adversely impacted industry in 2020
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The coronavirus pandemic is expected to have an adverse effect on the industry in 2020 due to nationwide lockdowns, increase in unemployment rate, decline in business sentiment index, decrease in corporate profit and decline in consumer spending.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Out-of-home dining spurred demand prior to 2020
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Prior to the pandemic, out-of-home dining increased as per capita disposable income rose, affording more consumers to dine out. This led to more restaurant openings and cash flow at existing restaurants, increasing demand for commercial dishwashers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: International trade volatility due to US trade policies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: US protectionist policies led to volatility in imports as distributors frontloaded imports in 2017 to preempt higher duties. Steel and aluminum tariffs raised costs for industry manufacturers, hurting profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry expected to grow as economy rebounds
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2025, the industry is expected to grow as the economy rebounds from the pandemic. Consumer spending is projected to increase, flowing through to food service businesses and increasing demand for new equipment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Import competition to remain a challenge
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Import competition is expected to continue challenging the industry over the next five years, though further protectionist measures by the US are possible which could cause volatility.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry footprint and employment to expand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The possibility of continued trade obstacles is driving new investment in US manufacturing capacity. The number of industry establishments and employment are projected to increase over the next five years.

industry_definition: The Commercial Dishwasher Manufacturing industry includes companies that manufacture commercial dishwashers for end consumers such as restaurants, hotels and military establishments. Products include conveyor dishwashers, undercounter dishwashers and door-type dishwashers.

negative_impact_factors: Low and steady level of assistance

key_trends: The industry's steady food manufacturing market has helped it fare downturns
The coronavirus pandemic is expected to have an adverse effect on the industry
US household appliance manufacturers have generally been losing ground to imports
Food service spending will continue to grow with a rebounding economy
Import competition is expected to continue challenging the industry
Despite a slight slowdown in demand, the industry's footprint is expected to expand
Although demand for industry products is generally stable, the industry contends with strong international competition

market_segmentation.segment_description: The largest market requiring large conveyor dishwashers for production facilities. Expected to account for 38.4% of revenue in 2020 but demand is decreasing due to the pandemic.
Expected to account for 20.1% of revenue in 2020 but decreasing due to the pandemic disrupting global supply chains.
Expected to account for 18.1% of revenue in 2020.
Estimated to generate 16.4% of revenue in 2020, primarily through the Restaurant and Hotel Equipment Wholesaling industry. Demand expected to decrease due to pandemic disruptions.
Expected to account for 7.0% of revenue in 2020. Demand decreasing due to temporary/permanent closures of restaurants, hotels and schools during the pandemic.

products_and_services.product_description: The most efficient type, capable of cleaning up to 350 racks/hour using 0.7 gallons/rack. Expensive but in high demand from food manufacturers and large restaurants.
Less efficient than conveyor models but smaller and less expensive. Clean about 45 racks/hour using 1.2 gallons/rack. Large share manufactured abroad due to high production costs.
Suited for smaller dishes, washing about 20 racks/hour using 1.2 gallons/rack. Smaller size desirable for export markets with limited retail space. Expected 20.0% revenue share in 2020.
Includes hood washers and specialty washers designed for certain products like glassware or pots/pans. Relatively stable segment over the years.

tier_1_suppliers: Electric Power Transmission in the US
Industrial Building Construction in the US
Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Scientific Research & Development in the US
Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
Plastic Pipe & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Electrical Equipment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Commercial Building Construction in the US
Restaurant & Hotel Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_buyers: Accommodation and Food Services in the US
Frozen Food Production in the US
Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The trade-weighted index measures the strength of the US dollar relative to other currencies. When it falls, it boosts demand for domestically manufactured commercial dishwashers as they become relatively less expensive.
When energy and water prices rise, downstream industries become interested in conserving energy and water, stimulating demand for energy-efficient commercial dishwashers.
Regulation requiring a certain level of energy or water efficiency to clean a number of racks could force downstream industries to invest in new commercial dishwashers, boosting demand.

When consumer spending rises, especially on dining out, new facilities requiring commercial dishwashers emerge and existing ones are more likely to invest in upgraded models, stimulating industry demand.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports are expected to satisfy 42.7% of domestic demand in 2020, up from 37.1% in 2015, indicating high and increasing import penetration.
The top sources of imports are China (42.2%), South Korea (28.3%), Germany (9.1%) and Thailand (12.6%).
Canada generates an estimated 94.6% of export revenue due to proximity and trade agreements like USMCA.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region dominates in terms of both establishments and population.
The Great Lakes region has a higher percentage of establishments compared to its population percentage.
The Southwest region has a moderate share of both establishments and population.
The West Plains region has a relatively lower share of establishments and population.
The Mid-Atlantic region has a relatively lower share of establishments and population.
The New England region has a relatively lower share of establishments and population.
The Rocky Mountains region has a relatively lower share of establishments and population.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Commercial dishwasher manufacturing facilities are subject to numerous laws and regulations designed to protect the environment and ensure product safety.
regulations_points.regulation_description: Some environmental laws and regulations require federal, state or other governmental licenses and permits with regard to wastewater discharges, air emissions and hazardous waste management. The Federal Trade Commission has stipulated rules concerning disclosures regarding energy consumption and water use of commercial dishwashers.

regulations_points.regulation_title: There are at least three types of standards, comprising the following: safety/environmental standards used for conformity assessment to safety or environmental requirements; energy-efficiency standards that set minimum efficiency requirements, often prescribed in government regulations; and test procedures standards that prescribe a method of test for determining performance characteristics and energy efficiency of dishwashing product.
regulations_points.regulation_description: There are initiatives in place to harmonize standards on an international basis to reduce conformity assessment costs, decrease regulatory burden, reduce manufacturing and distribution costs and get innovations to the market quicker.

regulations_points.regulation_title: In June 2012, Energy Star revised its guidelines for commercial dishwasher products labeled 'Energy Star' certified. These new guidelines entered into effect on February 2013.
regulations_points.regulation_description: While meeting Energy Star specifications may require research and development costs for some manufacturers, the expected higher prices charged to consumers due to increased demand for these products should offset these costs. Achieving Energy Star certification is not required, but is desired to increase sales.

barriers_points.barrier_description: New entrants face large start-up costs for facilities, materials, machinery, advertising and marketing to build brand reputation. Technical expertise and financial resources for R&D are required.
Developing innovative dishwashers requires expensive R&D, creating a barrier. New entrants tend to start small with limited standard product ranges lacking competitive advantage.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete on location and product innovation. Coastal players benefit from proximity to ports and population centers, lowering transportation costs. Product innovation for energy and water efficiency is important.
Industry operators compete with foreign manufacturers. Imports have increased from 33.2% of domestic demand in 2015 to estimated 42.7% in 2020.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top 3 largest companies make up an estimated 19.8% of industry revenue in 2020. The industry is fragmented with major import penetration increasing competitiveness.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases represent the single-largest expense category for industry operators.

Unfavorable economic conditions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, have decreased consumers' and companies' propensity to purchase premium, higher-priced products that allow companies to maintain a high margin.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Additionally, as overall demand has decreased, companies are unable to maintain a high profit margin.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to account for 4.9% of industry revenue in 2020, down from 5.6% in 2015.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Although the industry's steady investments in automation have reduced labor costs, it has also contended with higher material costs, particularly since tariffs on foreign steel and aluminum were implemented in 2018. Revenue that year rose strongly, but was largely the result of prices increasing to reflect higher input costs. As a result, profit declined as a share of total revenue. However, industry profit is expected to resume growing over the next five years as input costs stabilize and operators continue to make labor-saving investments.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The industry has steadily invested in capital improvements, much of which have gone toward labor-saving machinery.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As a result, wages have increased from 17.3% of revenue in 2015 to an estimated 19.6% in 2020.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs, which include direct inputs into the manufacture of industry products, are expected to account for 43.6% of revenue.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases have declined over the long term but have remained fairly stable over the past five years. Appliance manufacturers were largely able to pass cost increases related to tariffs on to downstream customers, though effects on demand.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation, which includes the cost of long-lived capital assets, is expected to account for 1.5% of industry revenue in 2020.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry has directed much of this capital investment toward production machinery.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchased advertising and promotional services are expected to absorb 0.7% of industry revenue in 2020.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry is somewhat fragmented and operators must invest in brand recognition. However, marketing costs are minimized by the industry's business-to-business sales model, which requires less heavy spending than targeting broad consumer markets.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rental costs, which mainly include building leases but also include some leased equipment, are expected to account for 1.2% of revenue.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry does not benefit from locating close to population centers where rents are high. According to the latest available data from the US Census Bureau, the average dishwasher is shipped more than 700.0 miles between factory and final sales channel.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Utility costs are expected to account for 0.6% of industry revenue.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: These costs include electric power, fuel, water treatment and telecommunications services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other expenses represent 27.8% of industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Capital intensity in the Commercial Dishwasher Manufacturing industry is low, but has increased over the past five years as operators have continued to make capital investments in machinery and focused on trimming labor spending.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2020, for every $1.00 spent on labor, the industry is expected to make $0.08 in capital investments. Capital intensity is expected to continue gradually rising over the next five years.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue volatility in the Commercial Dishwasher Manufacturing industry has been moderate over the past five years.
volatility_points.volatility_description: In general, the industry moves in line with consumer spending over the long term, as consumer dollars flow to restaurants and raise their equipment purchases. However, year to year purchases are determined in part by business sentiment and the availability of financing. In addition, tariffs implemented over the period added volatility in trade patterns, which also resulted in fluctuations in industry sales. For example, the threat of tariffs led domestic distributors to frontload imports in 2017 and purchase fewer domestically made products. Consequently, industry revenue declined 1.5% that year. Then, steel and aluminum tariffs raised industry costs and prices, leading to price hikes and 7.3% revenue growth in 2018. The COVID-19 pandemic has created unfavorable economic conditions in 2020, decreasing consumer spending.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: There have been several innovations in the Commercial Dishwasher Manufacturing industry, including advances in energy and water efficiency and noise reduction.
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Further, the number of Energy Star-certified devices is increasing yearly as more manufacturers attempt to satisfy downstream demand for more efficient devices.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The major technological developments in the industry's production processes have included increased automation (including use of robots), computer-aided design and manufacturing, and improvements in materials.
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Large players have launched e-commerce platforms for retailers, which enable retailers to obtain product information via the web, order products and access stock data. These online platforms assist with wholesale bypass, which ultimately leads to higher margins for commercial dishwasher manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Over the long term, imports have gradually captured a larger share of the domestic market.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: The largest industry operators tend to produce other commercial equipment, gaining the advantage of deeper customer relations.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: The industry has focused on energy efficiency in its newest product lines.

FAQs.question: Has your company located in proximity to its key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: On average, a dishwasher is shipped more than 700.0 miles to its final destination since industry operators have not focused on locating close to population centers.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Steady capital investments have helped reduce labor as a cost component over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Does your company use SAP software systems to optimize all aspects of manufacturing, sales, inventory and distribution channels?
FAQs.answer: The industry has very few establishments and serves customers nationwide. Therefore, internal logistics is a major competitive factor.

FAQs.question: What effect have international tariffs had on your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: Tariffs have raised the costs of important industry inputs, hurting profit margins for manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Energy efficiency standards in the industry have largely been implemented as a marketing tactic rather than a regulatory response.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Capital costs are moderate and steady in the industry.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your company's customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Dishwashers are often a one-time capital cost, so aside from some restaurant chains the industry does not generate much repeat business.

FAQs.question: Are you able to leverage economies of scale? What is your budget for expanding operations?
FAQs.answer: Since commercial dishwashers are expensive to manufacture, buying inputs in bulk saves the company money. Achieving economies of scale helps maintain margins.
